summary: This document is an email exchange from June 30, 2008, discussing the plea deal and sentencing of Jeffrey Epstein for soliciting prostitution from underage girls in Florida. It includes details of the sentence, financial penalties, and mentions related lawsuits.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from underage girls and was sentenced to 18 months in jail, followed by a year of house arrest, and designated a sex offender. He was also ordered to pay damages to victims.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested two years prior to the 2008 sentencing, based on allegations of paying underage girls for sexual massages.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from underage girls in South Florida.
He was sentenced to 18 months in the Palm Beach County jail, followed by a year of house arrest, and designated a sex offender.
As part of the resolution, Epstein had to pay a minimum of $150,000 in damages to each of 31 girls.
The allegations involved paying girls under 18 $200-$300 for naked massages at his Palm Beach home that sometimes became sexual.
Epstein also faced state and federal lawsuits from several women over similar allegations at the time.
